title: Sheffield City Centre Short Holiday Lets / Serviced Accommodation

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
I’m interested to understand how the council is handling the proliferation of new short term holiday lets / serviced apartments within Sheffield.
1.  How many Community Protection Warning Notices (the warning that precedes the full ASBO under section 5(a) of the Anti-social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Act 2014) have been issued by Sheffield City Council to landlords / operators of short term holiday lets / serviced apartments in Sheffield, since 1 May 2023?
2.  Does Sheffield City Council require a change of use to be approved before a residential property is turned into holiday lets / serviced apartments?
3. Please provide all complaints received by the council about:
3.1 apartment 305, West One Plaza, Cavendish Street, Sheffield, S3 7SJ
3.2 apartment 418, Royal Plaza Westfield Terrace, Sheffield S1 4GG
since 1 May 2023. If the actual complaints can’t be provided, please provide the number.
4 Please provide all correspondence relating to change of use approval / enforcement that has been received / sent relating to the properties listed at 3.1 and 3.2.
5. Does the council have a process by which it checks whether landlords / operators of holiday lets / serviced apartments have received Community Protection Warning Notices in other parts of the country?  If so, please clarify how this works.
Yours faithfully,
Elspeth Merton

Dear Elspeth Merton,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Sheffield City
Centre Short Holiday Lets / Serviced Accommodation which we received on
12/04/2024.
We apologise for the delay in responding.
Please find our response below.
1.  How many Community Protection Warning Notices (the warning that
precedes the full ASBO under section 5(a) of the Anti-social Behaviour,
Crime and Policing Act 2014) have been issued by Sheffield City Council to
landlords / operators of short term holiday lets / serviced apartments in
Sheffield, since 1 May 2023?
2.  Does Sheffield City Council require a change of use to be approved
before a residential property is turned into holiday lets / serviced
apartments?
In most cases no, as there is no material change of use, but it depends on
the merits of case/fact and degree i.e. the size, nature and location of
the accommodation and whether the use has an impact on the character of
the premises and the area.
3. Please provide all complaints received by the council about:
3.1 apartment 305, West One Plaza, Cavendish Street, Sheffield, S3 7SJ
3.2 apartment 418, Royal Plaza Westfield Terrace, Sheffield S1 4GG
since 1 May 2023. If the actual complaints can’t be provided, please
provide the number.
Information not held.
4 Please provide all correspondence relating to change of use approval /
enforcement that has been received / sent relating to the properties
listed at 3.1 and 3.2.
N/A
5. Does the council have a process by which it checks whether landlords /
operators of holiday lets / serviced apartments have received Community
Protection Warning Notices in other parts of the country?  If so, please
clarify how this works.
Information not held.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
